content: Investments Online Brokerages ETF Asked by AnonymousAsked on 16 Jun 2019Which online brokerage would you recommend for foreign etfs?Hi everyone, I'm looking to buy the irish-domiciled IWDA at some point. Which brokerage would you recommend for foreign equities? If I'm not mistaken, most local banks charge quite a high fee for it4 answersAnswerBump2
Answers (4)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Billy Ko, President - Investment Club at Singapore Institute Of TechnologyLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 16 Jun 2019Similar to Kenneth, I use FSM One as well and the main reason is the tranferring of money. I noticed that other brokerages either utilises Wire transfer or cheque but FSM One allows bank transfers using FAST which allows same day transfer, saves the hassle of having to write a cheque etc.0 comments1
Harvey TanLevel 5. GeniusUpdated on 30 Jun 2019Interactive broker. Cheap and reputable0 comments0

Kenneth Lou, Co-founder at SeedlyLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 16 Jun 2019I personally use FSM ONE for my overseas trades: https://seedly.sg/reviews/online-brokerages/fsm-oneMainly for the interface also the convinience of setting up the account.I know the fees per trade are a little higher but it is marginally more than others like Interactive Brokers (also highly recommended by the community)0 comments0
Jonathan Chia Guangrong, Fund Manager at JCG FundLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 16 Jun 2019Can try standard chartered or interactive brokers0 comments0
